alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 3:47PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River near Stratford affecting Spink and Brown Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Stratford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, 137th Street and 140th Street are flooded * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM CDT Saturday was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15 feet early Sunday morning. The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning. Additional rises are expected later in the week by Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued early Monday by 1245 AM CDT.
